item.title: Force
item.description: Force: Tooling’s Critical Balancing Act In rotary die cutting, we apply enough force within a small area to cause the material to actually fail, or break. So understanding the principles behind force is essential for productivity and longer tool life. Measuring Force Different materials require varying amounts of force. At Wilson, we try to successfully cut at 75 to 100 lbs per one inch cross blade. The reason we use the cross-blade dimension is that this is the largest blade area in contact with the material.

item.title: Steel?
item.description: carbon | chromium | vanadium Not all Steel is Created Equal Steel is an alloy of iron. An alloy takes a basic element—in this case, iron—and adds other elements to it to enhance certain properties. For applications in our industry, these additional elements include carbon, chromium, and vanadium. The impact of elements

item.title: HT45 Die
item.description: The HT45 die is used strictly for short run pressure-sensitive applications.

item.title: Keith Chrisco
item.description: About Me Keith works hard to make die purchasing much easier for his customers. Twenty years of experience at Wilson help Keith to offer extensive technical knowledge of the converting process. A proven expertise in problem-solving—particularly for automotive, gasket and specialty die-cutting applications, helps him manage little details most competitors miss. Away from work, Keith devotes his free time to hunting, fishing and working his farm in northern Missouri.

item.title: M80 Die
item.description: The M80 die is designed for both short run metal-to-metal and long run pressure-sensitive applications. Compared to HT45 steel, this steel achieves a greater level of hardness making it the perfect choice for long runs!

item.title: Print Cylinders
item.description: Wilson print cylinders are manufactured on CNC equipment with stringent standards for guaranteed accuracy. Cylinders are available for all makes of equipment with spur- and helical-type gears. For an additional fee, cylinders are available with a hard-coat finish to provide protection from razor blade scratches.

item.title: Tonia Boswell
item.description: About Me For Tonia, customer satisfaction and service is always the number one priority. Tonia first joined Wilson in 2004, and is dedicated to customer support for the territory covered by sales representative Mari Werner. During her free time, Tonia stays busy raising her two young children, and enjoys reading, boating and water sports.

item.title: Vacuum Insert
item.description: The M80 die is designed for both short run metal-to-metal and long run pressure-sensitive applications. Compared to HT45 steel, this steel achieves a greater level of hardness making it the perfect choice for long runs!
